legalRequirements.title: Real Estate Attorney (Optional)
legalRequirements.description: Legal representation - optional in California but recommended

legalRequirements.title: Title Insurance
legalRequirements.description: Protection against title defects and ownership issues

legalRequirements.title: Natural Hazard Disclosure
legalRequirements.description: Disclosure of earthquake, flood, fire, and other natural hazard zones

legalRequirements.title: Transfer Disclosure Statement (TDS)
legalRequirements.description: Seller must disclose known material facts about the property

costs.title: Title Insurance
costs.description: One-time premium for title insurance policy

costs.title: Escrow Fees
costs.description: Fees for escrow company handling the transaction

costs.title: Property Tax
costs.description: Annual property tax based on assessed value

costs.title: HOA Fees
costs.description: Homeowners association fees for condos and some communities

seasonalConsiderations.title: Peak Buying Season
seasonalConsiderations.description: Highest inventory but most competition. Ideal weather statewide.

seasonalConsiderations.title: Active Market
seasonalConsiderations.description: Good inventory levels. Hot weather in inland areas may affect viewings.

seasonalConsiderations.title: Best Weather Period
seasonalConsiderations.description: Excellent weather conditions. Motivated sellers before holidays.

seasonalConsiderations.title: Holiday Season Slowdown
seasonalConsiderations.description: Lower inventory but less competition. Rainy season in Northern California.

steps.title: Assess Your Financial Situation
steps.description: Evaluate your income, debts, and savings to determine your home buying budget

resources.title: California Home Buying Guide
resources.description: Comprehensive guide to buying a home in California

tips: California home prices are among the highest in the US
Consider earthquake insurance in high-risk areas
Factor in Mello-Roos taxes for newer developments

steps.title: Understanding California Disclosures
steps.description: Learn about mandatory seller disclosures in California

resources.title: California Disclosure Requirements
resources.description: Guide to mandatory disclosures in California real estate

tips: Review all disclosures carefully within the disclosure period
Ask questions about any unclear information
Consider hiring professionals for specialized inspections

steps.title: Earthquake Risk Assessment
steps.description: Evaluate earthquake risks and insurance needs

resources.title: California Earthquake Authority
resources.description: Information about earthquake insurance and risk

tips: Standard homeowners insurance doesn't cover earthquake damage
Consider earthquake retrofitting for older homes
Understand liquefaction and landslide risks in your area

resources.title: California Department of Real Estate
resources.description: State regulatory agency for real estate professionals

resources.title: California Association of Realtors
resources.description: Professional association for California real estate agents

resources.title: California Housing Finance Agency
resources.description: State housing finance agency with first-time buyer programs

governmentPrograms.title: CalHFA Conventional Loan Program
governmentPrograms.description: Down payment assistance for first-time home buyers
eligibility: Meet income and purchase price limits

governmentPrograms.title: Mortgage Credit Certificate (MCC)
governmentPrograms.description: Federal tax credit for mortgage interest payments
benefits: Up to 20% tax credit on mortgage interest
governmentPrograms.applicationProcess: Apply through CalHFA at time of loan application
